main event: A large, green fireball was sighted crossing Cayuga Lake, New York on April 3, 1952.
interesting points: The fireball was described as a sizable ball of fire, green in color with green flames streaking out.
The object was traveling very rapidly in an arc from the northeast to the northwest.
The sighting was made by a husband, who was a crew chief at Robinson Airlines with 12 years of experience in aeronautics, and a friend who was a school teacher.
The sighting lasted for approximately 30 seconds before the object disappeared to the north.
The report was not forwarded sooner because the individual who witnessed the event had not seen the request in the April 7th issue of Life Magazine until later.
witnesses: a husband who was a crew chief at Robinson Airlines and a school teacher friend
